get.description: You can request information about a project’s approval configuration using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

post.description: If you are allowed to, you can change approval configuration using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: approvals_before_merge
parameters.description: How many approvals are required before an MR can be merged. Deprecated in 12.0 in favor of Approval Rules API.

parameters.name: reset_approvals_on_push
parameters.description: Reset approvals on a new push

parameters.name: disable_overriding_approvers_per_merge_request
parameters.description: Allow or prevent overriding approvers per MR

parameters.name: merge_requests_author_approval
parameters.description: Allow or prevent authors from self approving merge requests; true means authors can self approve

parameters.name: merge_requests_disable_committers_approval
parameters.description: Allow or prevent committers from self approving merge requests

parameters.name: require_password_to_approve
parameters.description: Require approver to enter a password to authenticate before adding the approval

get.description: You can request information about a project’s approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

get.description: You can request information about a single project approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of a approval rule

post.description: You can create project approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the approval rule

parameters.name: approvals_required
parameters.description: The number of required approvals for this rule

parameters.name: rule_type
parameters.description: The type of rule. any_approver is a pre-configured default rule with approvals_required at 0. Other rules are regular.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The ids of users as approvers

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: The ids of groups as approvers

parameters.name: protected_branch_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of protected branches to scope the rule by. To identify the ID, use the API.

parameters.name: report_type
parameters.description: The report type required when the rule type is report_approver. The supported report types are: vulnerability, license_scanning, code_coverage. The vulnerability report type is part of the Vulnerability-Check feature, which deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: scanners
parameters.description: The security scanners the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported scanners are: sast, secret_detection, dependency_scanning, container_scanning, dast, coverage_fuzzing, api_fuzzing. Defaults to all supported scanners. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: severity_levels
parameters.description: The severity levels the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported severity levels are: info, unknown, low, medium, high, critical. Defaults to unknown, high, and critical. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: vulnerabilities_allowed
parameters.description: The number of vulnerabilities allowed for the Vulnerability-Check approval rule. Defaults to 0. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: vulnerability_states
parameters.description: The vulnerability states the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported vulnerability states are: newly_detected (default), detected, confirmed, resolved, dismissed. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

put.description: You can update project approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of a approval rule

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the approval rule

parameters.name: approvals_required
parameters.description: The number of required approvals for this rule

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The ids of users as approvers

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: The ids of groups as approvers

parameters.name: protected_branch_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of protected branches to scope the rule by. To identify the ID, use the API.

parameters.name: scanners
parameters.description: The security scanners the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported scanners are: sast, secret_detection, dependency_scanning, container_scanning, dast, coverage_fuzzing, api_fuzzing. Defaults to all supported scanners. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: severity_levels
parameters.description: The severity levels the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported severity levels are: info, unknown, low, medium, high, critical. Defaults to unknown, high, and critical. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: vulnerabilities_allowed
parameters.description: The number of vulnerabilities allowed for the Vulnerability-Check approval rule. Defaults to 0. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

parameters.name: vulnerability_states
parameters.description: The vulnerability states the Vulnerability-Check approval rule considers. The supported vulnerability states are: newly_detected (default), detected, confirmed, resolved, dismissed. Deprecated in GitLab 14.8, and planned for removal in GitLab 15.0.

delete.description: You can delete project approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of a approval rule

get.description: You can request information about a merge request’s approval status using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of MR

post.description: If you are allowed to, you can change approvals_required using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of MR

parameters.name: approvals_required
parameters.description: Approvals required before MR can be merged. Deprecated in 12.0 in favor of Approval Rules API.

get.summary: Get the approval state of merge requests
get.description: You can request information about a merge request’s approval state by using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of MR

get.description: You can request information about a merge request’s approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of MR

get.summary: Get a single merge request level rule
get.description: You can request information about a single merge request approval rule using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project.

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of a merge request.

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of an approval rule.

post.description: You can create merge request approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of MR

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the approval rule

parameters.name: approvals_required
parameters.description: The number of required approvals for this rule

parameters.name: approval_project_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of a project-level approval rule

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The ids of users as approvers

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: The ids of groups as approvers

put.description: You can update merge request approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project.

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of a merge request.

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of an approval rule.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the approval rule.

parameters.name: approvals_required
parameters.description: The number of required approvals for this rule.

parameters.name: user_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of users as approvers.

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of groups as approvers.

delete.description: You can delete merge request approval rules using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of the merge request

parameters.name: approval_rule_id
parameters.description: The ID of an approval rule

post.description: If you are allowed to, you can approve a merge request using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of the merge request

parameters.name: sha
parameters.description: The HEAD of the merge request

parameters.name: approval_password
parameters.description: Current user’s password. Required if Require user password to approve is enabled in the project settings.

post.description: If you did approve a merge request, you can unapprove it using the following endpoint:

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of a project

parameters.name: merge_request_iid
parameters.description: The IID of a merge request
